cs.IT, cs.SI, cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with channel polarization, which is a topic in information theory (cs.IT). The use of transformations to achieve polarization is a common technique in this field, and the paper specifically considers a generalization of Ar\i kan's polar code construction. This suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-category of coding theory (cs.SI). The paper also involves analyzing the behavior of these transformations on binary-input memoryless channels, which falls under the sub-category of communication complexity (cs.CC). Additionally, the paper may be relevant to the sub-categories of data structures (cs.DS) and machine learning (cs.LG) due to the use of matrix transformations and the potential applications of channel polarization in these fields.
